com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveDatabaseIf

All Superinterfaces:
XhiveLockingContextIf
public interface XhiveDatabaseIf
extends XhiveLockingContextIf

Represents an X-Hive/DB database. The XhiveDatabaseIf offers access to:

  • The root library.
  • The list of users.
  • The list of groups.
  • The physical structure of the database

    • By default, the database has an administrator user, that cannot be removed.

    Since X-Hive 3.0 databases can be spread over segments. A segment is a logical unit in which data is stored an is made up by mutilple physical units of storage, namely files. These files can be spread across multiple paths. Each database has a default segment, which cannot be deleted other than by deleteing the complete database, and each segment in its turn has a default file which cannot be deleted other than by deleting the complete segment.

    (c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

    Since:
    X-Hive/DB 1.0
    See Also:
    more about database security

    See Also:
    Constant Field Values

    RAM_SEGMENT_NAME

    static final java.lang.String RAM_SEGMENT_NAME
    The name of a ficticious segment that is not written to disk. If you set the temporary data segment to this value, temporary data will never be written to disk, but kept in the database cache. This limits the amount of temporary data that can be used. It can be useful for a readonly federation ran from a CDROM or similar readonly media.

    Since:
    X-Hive/DB 5.1
    See Also:
    Constant Field Values

    createSegment

    XhiveSegmentIf createSegment(java.lang.String id,
                             java.lang.String path,
                             long maxSize)
    Creates a new segment. The newly create segment exist of a single file, the default file.

    This method can only be used if the user is connected as administrator or superuser.

    Parameters:
    id - unique id for the segment to create.
    path - The path to location where the default file of the segment should be created on. If null then the path is the same as that for the federation default database.
    maxSize - The maximum size (in bytes) that the file is allowed to grow to. A value of 0 means the size is unlimited.
    Returns:
    the newly created segment
    Throws:
    XhiveException.SEGMENT_ID_EXISTS - if a segment with the same id already exists.
    XhiveException.ACCESS_DENIED - if this method is called when the user is not connected as administrator or superuser.
    Since:
    X-Hive 3.0

    createTemporaryDataSegment

    XhiveSegmentIf createTemporaryDataSegment(java.lang.String id,
                                          java.lang.String path,
                                          long maxSize)
    Creates a new segment for temporary data. A temporary data segment can only contain temporary data. Because the contents of such a segment do not have to be recovered, updates are not logged, which is more efficient. The newly created segment exists of a single file, the default file.

    This method can only be used if the user is connected as administrator or superuser.

    Parameters:
    id - unique id for the segment to create.
    path - The path to location where the default file of the segment should be created on. If null then the path is the same as that for the federation default database.
    maxSize - The maximum size (in bytes) that the file is allowed to grow to. A value of 0 means the size is unlimited.
    Returns:
    the newly created segment
    Throws:
    XhiveException.SEGMENT_ID_EXISTS - if a segment with the same id already exists.
    XhiveException.ACCESS_DENIED - if this method is called when the user is not connected as administrator or superuser.
    Since:
    X-Hive/DB 5.1

    getDefaultSegment

    XhiveSegmentIf getDefaultSegment()
    Returns the default segment of this database.

    This method can only be used if the user is connected as administrator or superuser.

    Returns:
    the default segment of this database
    Throws:
    XhiveException.ACCESS_DENIED - if this method is called when the user is not connected as administrator or superuser.

    Since:

    setTemporaryDataSegment

    void setTemporaryDataSegment(java.lang.String segmentId)
    Set the segment that contains all temporary data. For example, nodes created by XQuery queries. Setting this to null implies the default segment. The selected segment does not have to be a temporary data segment, although it may be more efficient if it is. It can also be the special value RAM_SEGMENT_NAME.

    Since:
    X-Hive/DB 5.1

    getTemporaryDataSegment

    java.lang.String getTemporaryDataSegment()
    Get the segment that is used for temporary data.

    Since:
    X-Hive/DB 5.1

    deserializeRootLibrary

    void deserializeRootLibrary(java.io.InputStream input)
                            throws java.io.IOException
    Replace the root library by a previously serialized library. Reads a library that was written using XhiveLibraryChildIf.serialize(java.io.OutputStream). The current root library is replaced by this library.

    If the library read did not have a local catalog, an empty catalog will be added to the new root library.

    Parameters:
    input - The java.io.InputStream to read the library from.
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - Only if the input stream passed throws a java.io.IOException.
    Since:
    X-Hive/DB 5.1

    serializeUsers

    void serializeUsers(java.io.OutputStream out)
                    throws java.io.IOException
    Serialize all users and groups to the given output stream. The users are serialized in an internal binary format suitable for loading with deserializeUsers(java.io.InputStream).

    Parameters:
    out - The output stream to write to. No buffering is done internally, so be sure to use a java.io.BufferedOutputStream where it matters. The stream is flushed, but not closed, by this method.
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - Only if the output stream passed throws a java.io.IOException.
    Since:
    X-Hive/DB 6.1

    deserializeUsers

    void deserializeUsers(java.io.InputStream input)
                      throws java.io.IOException
    Replace all users and groups by a set previously serialized using serializeUsers(java.io.OutputStream). Note: all current instances of XhiveUserListIf and XhiveGroupListIf become invalid when using this method.

    Parameters:
    input - The java.io.InputStream to read the users and groups from.
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - Only if the input stream passed throws a java.io.IOException.
    Since:
    X-Hive/DB 6.1
